title: 115_hr1598
content:
The Act is titled the "Ninth Circuit Court Modernization and Twelfth Circuit Court Creation Act of 2017". It defines the former ninth circuit, new ninth circuit, and twelfth circuit. It also addresses the number and composition of circuits. SEC. 3. The number and composition of circuits are amended, with the ninth circuit becoming the new ninth circuit and the twelfth circuit being created to include Alaska, Arizona, Idaho, Montana, Nevada, Oregon, Washington, Guam, and Hawaii. SEC. 4. The number of circuit judges is also adjusted. The table in section 48(a) of title 28, United States Code, is amended to include Las Vegas, Phoenix, Anchorage, and Missoula in the twelfth circuit, removing Portland and Seattle from the ninth circuit. SEC. 6. JUDGESHIPS.

Each circuit judge from the former ninth circuit in active service in Alaska, Arizona, Idaho, Montana, Oregon, Washington, Guam, Hawaii, Northern Mariana Islands, or Nevada will be part of the new ninth circuit. The President will appoint 17 circuit judges for the new twelfth circuit from the assigned states. Their official duty stations will be in Las Vegas, Phoenix, Anchorage, and Missoula as per the amended table in section 48(a) of title 28, United States Code.

SEC. 7. ELECTION OF ASSIGNMENT BY SENIOR JUDGES. SEC. 7. Senior judges from the former ninth circuit in specific states can choose to be assigned to the new ninth or twelfth circuit. They must notify the Director of the Administrative Office of the United States Courts of their decision. SEC. 8. The seniority of judges appointed under section 6(b) will start from their commission as a judge of the twelfth circuit. SEC. 9. The provisions apply to cases. The Act specifies procedures for cases pending in the former ninth circuit before the effective date of the Act. If a matter has been submitted for decision, further proceedings will continue as if the Act had not been enacted. If a matter has not been submitted, it will be transferred to the appropriate court as if the Act had been in effect, and further proceedings will follow. If a petition for rehearing en banc is pending on or after the effective date of this Act, it will be considered by the court of appeals as if the Act had been in full force and effect at the time of filing. SEC. 10. ADMINISTRATION: The court of appeals for the ninth circuit may take administrative action to implement this Act and its amendments. SEC. 11. EFFECTIVE DATE: This Act and its amendments take effect immediately upon enactment. SEC. 12. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS: Sums are authorized to be appropriated for the implementation of this Act and its amendments, including providing space and facilities for new judicial positions.
